column1: 0;MU;Micron Technology;2017-03-23T20:35:27Z;Rising sales jolt Micron shares higher;;Semiconductor maker Micron Technologies saw its shares soar in after-market trading on Thursday after it announced its latest quarterly revenues were 58 per cent higher than the same time a year ago.Micron chief executive Mark Durcan credited the results from the second quarter of its fiscal 2017 to “strong demand and limited industry supply” for its DRAM and NAND memory chips
column2: as well as ongoing cost-cutting efforts. Since the first quarter of the fiscal year
column3: DRAM average selling prices have jumped 21 per cent
column4: while trade NAND sales volumes have risen 18 per cent
column5: the company said.Revenue for the three-month period ending March 2 were $4.65bn
column6: in line with what analysts surveyed by Bloomberg had expected. Net income attributable to Micron shareholders was $894m
column8: versus the $887.8m profit and 78 cent-per share earnings analysts expected. It is also a marked improvement over the same three-month period last year
column9: when Micron chalked up a net loss of $97m
column10: or 9 cents a share.Falling manufacturing costs also helped it bring its gross margin up by 11.2 percentage points to 36.7 per cent
column11: compared to the first quarter of FY 2017Over the past 12 months
column12: Micron shares have zoomed 148.5 per cent higher. After its earnings release
column13: investors sent the company’s stock up nearly 8 per cent in after-hours trading.
